alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 7:32PM PST until December 13 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following area, Monterey. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Del Monte Forest, Del Rey Oaks and Sand City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
